name: Matrix Rotation
description: Given a matrix represented as a list of string, such as ``` ###..... ..###... ....###. .....### .....### ....###. ..###... ###..... ``` write a function ```if:javascript `rotateClockwise(matrix)` ``` ```if:ruby,python `rotate_clockwise(matrix)` ``` that return its 90° clockwise rotation, for our example: ``` #......# #......# ##....## .#....#. .##..##. ..####.. ..####.. ...##... ``` > /!\ You must return a **rotated copy** of `matrix`! (`matrix` must be the same before and after calling your function) > Note that the matrix isn't necessarily a square, though it's always a rectangle! > Please also note that the equality `m == rotateClockwise(rotateClockwise(rotateClockwise(rotateClockwise(m))));` (360° clockwise rotation), is not always true because `rotateClockwise([''])` => `[]` and `rotateClockwise(['','',''])` => `[]` (empty lines information is lost)
